header.name: chaos/preprocessor/facilities/unbox.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines a macro used to abstract empty arguments.

macro.abstract: The macro is used to abstract empty arguments.
macro.para: If x is a unary parenthetic expression, this macro expands to the contents of that unary parenthetic expression. In C99, if __VA_ARGS__ is a parenthetic expression of any arity, this macro expands to the contents of that parenthetic expression. Otherwise, this macro expands to nothing.
In C and C++, x must be either a unary parenthetic expression or a non-parenthetic expression. Any other input is invalid.
This macro is used to simulate empty arguments--primarily in C (prior to C99) and C++.
